snippet: The music licensing agency tracked 500 billion performances of songs last year, paying $883 million to composers and publishers.
abstract: Music licensing agency Ascap releases preliminary results indicating that it made just over $1 billion in revenue in 2014, landmark result for struggling industry; paid $883 million to its members, up 4 percent from 2013, after tracking some 500 billion performances of their songs; increase is attributable both to the rising popularity of streaming services and advances in Ascap's ability to track performances.
lead_paragraph: The music licensing agency tracked 500 billion performances of songs last year, paying $883 million to composers and publishers.

headline.main: Ascap Topped $1 Billion in Revenue Last Year, Lifted by Streaming
headline.print_headline: Ascap Topped $1 Billion in Revenue Last Year, Lifted by Streaming

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers
